page.title: 14TRADITIONS IN ABBOTSKERSWELL
page.content: Beating the Bounds is a once every five years tradition. In the old days they did not have maps but they had stones to mark the boundaries of the parish.The outskirts of Abbotskerswell parish is about 11 miles. Adults and children walk around the outskirts of the parish and bump people on the stones lightly to mark the stone so they remember the boundary. On Mayday there is a mini market in the Village Hall, whilst outside the May Queen is crowned and the children from the village school dance round the Maypole and sing. At one end of the village there is a well, called Ladewell or Lady's Well. The waters from this well are supposed to be effective in curing eye diseases. There is a small Quaker Burial Ground just off Wilton Way.
